title: Getting Started With Spring -XD
content:
Spring XD is a unified distributed & extensible system for data ingestion, real time analytics, batch processing & data export. It is an open source Apache 2 licensed project. The main goal of Spring XD are:  1. To address big data complexity. 2. To develop and deploy Big Data Application. Big Data Complexity In real world big data application requires disparate system to work together so that it can generate a single cohesive solution. . An increasing number of systems are being built to handle the Volume, Velocity and Variety of Big Data.To tackle the problem that arises we need to have a unified, conceptual framework that can address complexity. Use Cases: Commonly used use cases for big data complexity are: 1. Ingestion of high throughput distributed data to a Big data store like Hadoop or splunk.In this Big data world, we have a lot of scenarios where we handle ingesting of large data, Eg: Ingesting of Twitter Stream on to HDFS which may be used for various analysis.

2. Real time analytics while data ingestion.

Spring XD provides feature for real time analytics while the data ingestion process happens.  In spring xd a special kind of stream is defined, which are known as taps . These allows  to "listen" to data while it is processed in an existing stream and process the data in a separate stream.

3. High throughput data export.

Spring XD also allows to export data from a big data store like Hadoop. Spring XD supports data export to various sinks like Hadoop, Mongo, Redis, Rabbit MQ.

Getting Started with Spring XD Installation Pre-requisites: 1. JDK 7 or above.

Steps: 1. Download the Spring xd zip :

https://repo.spring.io/libs-release/org/springframework/xd/spring-xd/1.2.0.RELEASE/spring-xd-1.2.0.RELEASE-dist.zip

  1. Unzip the folder and extract them to your machine .

Running Spring-xd 1. Go to spring-xd home/xd/bin folder and start single-node.bat

This starts the spring-xd in single-node mode which runs spring xd as a single process.

  1. To start the spring xd shell run xd-shell.bat in the spring-xd home/shell/bin folder

 

Live Twitter Stream using Spring-XD Shell command:   This command generates a live twitter stream. Details of the twitter stream generated are: Stream Name – mytwitterstream Source is the twitter search and uses the consumerKey and consumerSecret (Obtain it from the twitter developer section) Sink is the file. It generates a mytwitterstrem.out file in tmp\xd\output\ folder It searches for the token java.
